title: scLinaX_preprocessing_example
text: scLinaX takes single-cell-level allele-specific expression (chromatin accessibility) data gene annotation input. vignette, show example workflow making input cellsnp-lite Annovar described scLinaX paper.

title: scLinaX_preprocessing_example
text: First, prepare scRNA-seq (scATAC-seq) dataset scLinaX analysis. vignette, use multiome dataset provided 10X website. (https://www.10xgenomics.com) Since use X choromosome data, made bam files include reads derived X chromosomes. , show example python script. also need lists cell barcodes use cellsnp-lite. example, used barcode list generated Cell Ranger Arc software. case scATAC-seq analysis, can beneficial remove duplicate sequences. example, can use flag reported Cell Ranger software.
code: # Python script # Extract the X chromosome # Replace the suffix of the barcode (-1) with the data modality (RNA or ATAC) # Renaming the barcode is actually unnecessary in this case, but it will be necessary if you want to merge multiple runs of the same sample. # Therefore, we are changing the barcode name here as an example.  import pysam import pandas as pd import subprocess  bam_files=[] DIR='/path/to/DL_data/' BAM_LIST=['pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_gex_possorted_bam','pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_atac_possorted_bam']   for BAM in BAM_LIST:     input_bam=DIR+BAM+'.bam'     output_bam=BAM+'.barcode.renamed.X.bam'     bam_files.append(output_bam)      in_bam = pysam.AlignmentFile(input_bam, 'rb')     out_bam = pysam.AlignmentFile(output_bam, 'wb', template=in_bam)      if(BAM == 'pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_gex_possorted_bam'):         for aln in in_bam.fetch("chrX"):             if aln.has_tag("CB"):                 old_bc = aln.get_tag('CB')                 new_bc = old_bc.replace("-1", "-RNA")                 aln.set_tag('CB', new_bc)                 out_bam.write(aln)      elif(BAM == 'pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_atac_possorted_bam'):         for aln in in_bam.fetch("chrX"):             if aln.has_tag("CB"):                 old_bc = aln.get_tag('CB')                 new_bc = old_bc.replace("-1", "-ATAC")                 aln.set_tag('CB', new_bc)                 out_bam.write(aln)      in_bam.close()     out_bam.close()  subprocess.run(["samtools", "merge", "pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_gex_plus_atac_possorted.barcode.renamed.X.bam"] + bam_files, check=True) subprocess.run(["samtools", "sort", "-o", "Multiome_10x.RNA.ATAC.sorted.bam", "pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_gex_plus_atac_possorted.barcode.renamed.X.bam"], check=True) subprocess.run(["samtools", "index", "Multiome_10x.RNA.ATAC.sorted.bam"], check=True)  subprocess.run(["samtools", "sort", "-o", "Multiome_10x.RNA.sorted.bam", "pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_gex_possorted_bam.barcode.renamed.X.bam"], check=True) subprocess.run(["samtools", "index", "Multiome_10x.RNA.sorted.bam"], check=True)  subprocess.run(["samtools", "sort", "-o", "Multiome_10x.ATAC.sorted.bam", "pbmc_granulocyte_sorted_10k_atac_possorted_bam.barcode.renamed.X.bam"], check=True) subprocess.run(["samtools", "index", "Multiome_10x.ATAC.sorted.bam"], check=True) zcat /path/to/DL_data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix/barcodes.tsv.gz | \ sed 's/-1/-RNA/g' > Multiome_10x.RNA.filtered.barcode.list.tsv  zcat /path/to/DL_data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix/barcodes.tsv.gz | \ sed 's/-1/-ATAC/g' > Multiome_10x.ATAC.filtered.barcode.list.tsv samtools view -F 1024 -b Multiome_10x.ATAC.sorted.bam > Multiome_10x.ATAC.sorted.rmdup.bam samtools index Multiome_10x.ATAC.sorted.rmdup.bam

title: scLinaX_preprocessing_example
text: Now, ready run cellsnp-lite. example, use variant calling mode [2a]. However, genotype data, can try reference-based mode [1a]. can also specify common variants defined projects (e.g., 1000 Genome Project) run reference-based mode, faster. use custom R script RCODE_process_cellsnp.r process output. case scATAC-seq data, generally UMI. Therefore, need make slight adjustments configuration.
code: #scRNA-seq data info barcode_rna="Multiome_10x.RNA.filtered.barcode.list.tsv" bam_rna="Multiome_10x.RNA.sorted.bam" UMITAG_rna="UB"  #run cellsnp for RNA cellsnp-lite -s ${bam_rna} \ --minCOUNT 20 -b ${barcode_rna} \ --UMItag ${UMITAG_rna} -p 4 \ --minMAF 0.05 \ --minMAPQ 20 \ --refseq /path/to/refdata-cellranger-GRCh38-3.0.0/fasta/genome.fa \ #reference used in cell ranger arc --chrom=chrX -O RNA.chrX.snp.call  #process output for RNA Rscript /path/to/RCODE_process_cellsnp.r \ RNA.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.samples.tsv \ RNA.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.tag.AD.mtx \ RNA.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.tag.DP.mtx \ RNA.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.tag.OTH.mtx \ RNA.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.base.vcf \ RNA.chrX.snp.call.summary.tsv.gz #RCODE_process_cellsnp.r library(dplyr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(tidyr)  argv<-commandArgs(T)  SAMPLE_NAME=argv[1] ADmtx=argv[2] DPmtx=argv[3] OTHmtx=argv[4] VCF=argv[5] OUT=argv[6]  sample_name<-read_tsv(SAMPLE_NAME,col_names=FALSE) AD<-Matrix::readMM(ADmtx) DP<-Matrix::readMM(DPmtx) OTH<-Matrix::readMM(OTHmtx) RD<-DP-AD vcf<-read_tsv(VCF,comment="#",col_names=FALSE)  SNP_INFO<-mutate(vcf,SNP_ID=str_c(X1,":",X2,":",X4,":",X5))%>% dplyr::select(SNP_ID,X1,X2,X4,X5) colnames(SNP_INFO)<-c("SNP_ID","CHR","POS","REF","ALT")  alt_res<-AD%>%as.matrix()%>%as_tibble() colnames(alt_res)<-sample_name$X1 alt_res$SNP<-SNP_INFO$SNP_ID  ref_res<-RD%>%as.matrix()%>%as_tibble() colnames(ref_res)<-sample_name$X1 ref_res$SNP<-SNP_INFO$SNP_ID  oth_res<-OTH%>%as.matrix()%>%as_tibble() colnames(oth_res)<-sample_name$X1 oth_res$SNP<-SNP_INFO$SNP_ID  alt_res<-alt_res%>% pivot_longer(names_to="cell_barcode",values_to="ALTcount",-SNP)%>% filter(ALTcount>0)  ref_res<-ref_res%>% pivot_longer(names_to="cell_barcode",values_to="REFcount",-SNP)%>% filter(REFcount>0)  oth_res<-oth_res%>% pivot_longer(names_to="cell_barcode",values_to="OTHcount",-SNP)%>% filter(OTHcount>0)  result<-full_join(ref_res,alt_res,by=c("SNP","cell_barcode"))%>% full_join(oth_res,by=c("SNP","cell_barcode")) result<-left_join(SNP_INFO,result,alt_res,by=c("SNP_ID"="SNP")) result[is.na(result)]<-0 result<-dplyr::distinct(result)  write_tsv(result,OUT) #scATAC-seq data info barcode_atac="Multiome_10x.ATAC.filtered.barcode.list.tsv" bam_atac="Multiome_10x.ATAC.sorted.rmdup.bam" UMITAG_atac="None" # Different from the scRNA-seq  #run cellsnp for ATAC cellsnp-lite -s ${bam_atac} \ --minCOUNT 20 -b ${barcode_atac} \ --UMItag ${UMITAG_atac} -p 4 \ --minMAF 0.05 \ --minMAPQ 20 \ --refseq /path/to/refdata-cellranger-GRCh38-3.0.0/fasta/genome.fa \ #reference used in cell ranger arc --chrom=chrX -O ATAC.chrX.snp.call  #process output for ATAC Rscript /path/to/RCODE_process_cellsnp.r \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.samples.tsv \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.tag.AD.mtx \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.tag.DP.mtx \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.tag.OTH.mtx \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call/cellSNP.base.vcf \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call.summary.tsv.gz

title: scLinaX_preprocessing_example
text: ANNOVAR software annotate various information genetic variants. can download find detailed documentation website (https://annovar.openbioinformatics.org/en/latest/). addition gene-based annotation, also added allele frequency information variants subsequent quality control. Please download annotations necessary analysis following ANNOVAR User Guide (https://annovar.openbioinformatics.org/en/latest/user-guide/download/). Let’s run ANNOVAR genotype data derived scRNA-seq scATAC-seq data.
code: #  scRNA-seq zcat RNA.chrX.snp.call.summary.tsv.gz | \ awk -F"\t" 'NR>1 {print $2"\t"$3"\t"$3"\t"$4"\t"$5"\t"$1}' | \ LANG=C sort | LANG=C uniq \ > RNA.chrX.snp.call.summary.annov.input  /path/to/annovar/table_annovar.pl \ RNA.chrX.snp.call.summary.annov.input \ /path/to/annovar/humandb/ -buildver hg38 \ -out RNA.chrX.snp.call \ -remove -protocol refGene,ensGene,avsnp150,ALL.sites.2015_08 \ -operation g,g,f,f -nastring NA -polish  # scATAC-seq zcat ATAC.chrX.snp.call.summary.tsv.gz | \ awk -F"\t" 'NR>1 {print $2"\t"$3"\t"$3"\t"$4"\t"$5"\t"$1}' | \ LANG=C sort | LANG=C uniq \ > ATAC.chrX.snp.call.summary.annov.input  /path/to/annovar/table_annovar.pl \ ATAC.chrX.snp.call.summary.annov.input \ /path/to/annovar/humandb/ -buildver hg38 \ -out ATAC.chrX.snp.call \ -remove -protocol refGene,ensGene,avsnp150,ALL.sites.2015_08 \ -operation g,g,f,f -nastring NA -polish

title: scLinaX_preprocessing_example
text: final step, apply quality control (QC) allele-specific expression (chromatin accessibility) data based Annovar annotation. , provide example R script QC, filters based gene annotation allele information. can use Multiome_RNA_QC_passed_SNP_df.tsv.gz scLinaX analysis. Additionally, can use Multiome_ATAC_QC_passed_SNP_df.tsv.gz scLinaX-multi analysis.
code: #RCODE_QC.r library(tidyverse) library(viridis) library(ggpointdensity) library(patchwork)  argv<-commandArgs(T)  RNA_SNPCELL=argv[1] RNA_ANNOVAR=argv[2] ATAC_SNPCELL=argv[3] ATAC_ANNOVAR=argv[4]  if(FALSE){ #Example of input RNA_SNPCELL="RNA.chrX.snp.call.summary.tsv.gz" RNA_ANNOVAR="RNA.chrX.snp.call.hg38_multianno.txt"  ATAC_SNPCELL="ATAC.chrX.snp.call.summary.tsv.gz" ATAC_ANNOVAR="ATAC.chrX.snp.call.hg38_multianno.txt" }  #load raw data rna<-read_tsv(RNA_SNPCELL) atac<-read_tsv(ATAC_SNPCELL)  #load annotation data load_anno<-function(ANNOVAR){ anno<-read_tsv(ANNOVAR)%>% mutate(SNP_ID=str_c(Chr,Start,Ref,Alt,sep=":"))%>% dplyr::select(SNP_ID,Func.refGene,Gene.refGene,ALL.sites.2015_08) colnames(anno)<-c("SNP_ID","Region","Gene","ALL_Freq") anno$ALL_Freq[is.na(anno$ALL_Freq)]<-0 return(anno) }  rna_anno<-load_anno(RNA_ANNOVAR) atac_anno<-load_anno(ATAC_ANNOVAR)    #merge raw data + annotation data merge_anno<-function(data,anno){ df<-left_join(data,anno,by="SNP_ID")%>% filter(!str_detect(Gene,pattern=";"))%>% filter(!is.na(Gene))%>%filter(Region %in% c("intronic","UTR5","UTR3","exonic","ncRNA_exonic","ncRNA_intronic","splicing")) return(df) } rna_df<-merge_anno(rna,rna_anno) atac_df<-left_join(atac,atac_anno,by="SNP_ID")  rna_df_QC_pass<-filter(rna_df,ALL_Freq>0.01) atac_df_QC_pass<-filter(atac_df,ALL_Freq>0.01) write_tsv(rna_df_QC_pass,"Multiome_RNA_QC_passed_SNP_df.tsv.gz") #This QC-passed data should be used for the subsequent analyses write_tsv(atac_df_QC_pass,"Multiome_ATAC_QC_passed_SNP_df.tsv.gz") #This QC-passed data should be used for the subsequent analyses

title: scLinaX_vignette
text: One two X chromosomes females silenced X chromosome inactivation (XCI) compensate difference dosage sexes. Among X-linked genes, several genes escape XCI. scLinaX computational tool designed quantification escape X chromosome inactivation using single-cell RNA sequencing data obtained droplet-based methodologies.

title: scLinaX_vignette
text: First, load scLinaX package. demo, load test dataset included within scLinaX package well. like run scLinaX data, please prepare ASE data cell annotation data. original manuscript, prepared ASE data using cellsnp-lite Annovar. applied QC, namely variant filtering based allele frequency reference panels (e.g. 1000 genome project dataset). format like (Please also see reference dataset). Let’s run scLinaX! result list object including $reuslt $raw_exp_result used subsequent process. results summarized using summarize_scLinaX function analysis. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio expression inactivated X chromosome cells. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio expression inactivated X chromosome cell annotation. Let’s check result scLinaX analysis. minor_allele_ratio (ratio expression Xi) tend high escapee genes compared nonPAR genes expected.
code: library(scLinaX) data("XCI_ref") data("AIDA_QCREF") data("multiome_ASE_df") data("multiome_Annotation") head(multiome_ASE_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   SNP_ID           POS REF   ALT   cell_barcode REFcount ALTcount OTHcount Gene  #>   <chr>          <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>           <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr> #> 1 chrX:299800:… 299800 C     A     AAACCAACAGG…        1        0        0 PLCX… #> 2 chrX:299800:… 299800 C     A     ACAACACTCTA…        1        0        0 PLCX… #> 3 chrX:299800:… 299800 C     A     ACTAACTCATT…        1        0        0 PLCX… #> 4 chrX:299800:… 299800 C     A     ACTGAATGTGA…        1        0        0 PLCX… #> 5 chrX:299800:… 299800 C     A     CCGCTAAAGCT…        1        0        0 PLCX… #> 6 chrX:299800:… 299800 C     A     CGTTGCGCACA…        1        0        0 PLCX… #> # ℹ 1 more variable: Sample_ID <chr> head(multiome_Annotation) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   cell_barcode       Annotation #>   <chr>              <chr>      #> 1 AAACAGCCAATCCCTT-1 CD4 TCM    #> 2 AAACAGCCACACTAAT-1 CD8 Naive  #> 3 AAACAGCCACCAACCG-1 CD8 Naive  #> 4 AAACAGCCAGGATAAC-1 CD4 Naive  #> 5 AAACAGCCAGTTTACG-1 CD4 TCM    #> 6 AAACAGCCATCCAGGT-1 CD16 Mono scLinaX_res<-run_scLinaX(ASE_df=multiome_ASE_df,XCI_ref=XCI_ref,QCREF=AIDA_QCREF,                              Inactive_Gene_ratio_THR=0.05,SNP_DETECTION_DP=30,SNP_DETECTION_MAF=0.1,QC_total_allele_THR=10,                              HE_allele_cell_number_THR=50,REMOVE_ESCAPE=TRUE,PVAL_THR=0.01,RHO_THR=0.5) #> [1] "Start processing of sample 1 (total sample number = 1)" #> [1] "Finish processing of sample 1 (total sample number = 1)"   head(scLinaX_res$result) #> # A tibble: 6 × 24 #>   Sample_ID SNP_ID          CHR      POS REF   ALT   Gene  XCI_status Gene_class #>   <chr>     <chr>           <chr>  <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>      <fct>      #> 1 Multiome  chrX:101044782… nonP… 1.01e8 G     A     TRMT… inactive   nonPAR_in… #> 2 Multiome  chrX:10139201:… nonP… 1.01e7 C     G     WWC3  inactive   nonPAR_in… #> 3 Multiome  chrX:10144298:… nonP… 1.01e7 C     A     WWC3  inactive   nonPAR_in… #> 4 Multiome  chrX:101626444… nonP… 1.02e8 A     G     ARMC… inactive   nonPAR_in… #> 5 Multiome  chrX:101882824… nonP… 1.02e8 G     A     ZMAT1 variable   nonPAR_va… #> 6 Multiome  chrX:101931416… nonP… 1.02e8 G     A     ZMAT1 variable   nonPAR_va… #> # ℹ 15 more variables: Used_as_refGene <chr>, Used_as_refSNP <chr>, #> #   Total_A_allele <dbl>, Total_B_allele <dbl>, Total_allele <dbl>, #> #   Expressing_cells <int>, minor_allele_ratio <dbl>, Reference_Gene <chr>, #> #   Num_Reference_Gene <int>, Reference_SNP <chr>, Num_Reference_SNP <int>, #> #   Reference_Cell_Count <int>, Num_A_cells <int>, Num_B_cells <int>, #> #   Num_Fail_cells <int>   head(scLinaX_res$raw_exp_result) #> # A tibble: 6 × 20 #>   SNP_ID    Sample_ID    POS REF   ALT   cell_barcode REFcount ALTcount OTHcount #>   <chr>     <chr>      <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>           <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e8 G     A     ATGGTTATCCT…        1        0        0 #> 2 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e8 G     A     CAAGTGAAGTT…        1        0        0 #> 3 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e8 G     A     CACGCTAAGTT…        1        0        0 #> 4 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e8 G     A     GCTAAGAAGTT…        1        0        0 #> 5 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e8 G     A     GCTATTGCAAT…        1        0        0 #> 6 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e8 G     A     GTACTTCGTTG…        1        0        0 #> # ℹ 11 more variables: Gene <chr>, XCI_status <chr>, CHR <chr>, #> #   Gene_class <fct>, A_allele <dbl>, B_allele <dbl>, Xa <chr>, #> #   Used_as_refGene <chr>, Used_as_refSNP <chr>, Reference_SNP <chr>, #> #   Reference_Gene <chr> PBMC_summary<-summarize_scLinaX(scLinaX_res,QC_total_allele_THR=10,Annotation=NULL) head(PBMC_summary) #> # A tibble: 6 × 24 #>   Reference_SNP   Sample_ID Reference_Cell_Count SNP_ID CHR      POS REF   ALT   #>   <chr>           <chr>                    <int> <chr>  <chr>  <dbl> <chr> <chr> #> 1 chrX:47624401:… Multiome                  2056 chrX:… nonP… 1.54e8 G     A     #> 2 chrX:47624401:… Multiome                  2056 chrX:… nonP… 2.37e7 A     G     #> 3 chrX:47624401:… Multiome                  2056 chrX:… nonP… 1.10e8 T     C     #> 4 chrX:47624401:… Multiome                  2056 chrX:… PAR1  1.59e6 C     T     #> 5 chrX:47624401:… Multiome                  2056 chrX:… nonP… 1.58e7 C     T     #> 6 chrX:47624401:… Multiome                  2056 chrX:… nonP… 1.54e8 G     A     #> # ℹ 16 more variables: Gene <chr>, XCI_status <chr>, Gene_class <fct>, #> #   Used_as_refGene <chr>, Used_as_refSNP <chr>, Total_A_allele <dbl>, #> #   Total_B_allele <dbl>, Total_allele <dbl>, Expressing_cells <int>, #> #   minor_allele_ratio <dbl>, Reference_Gene <chr>, Num_Reference_Gene <int>, #> #   Num_Reference_SNP <int>, Num_A_cells <int>, Num_B_cells <int>, #> #   Num_Fail_cells <int>   cell_type_summary<-summarize_scLinaX(scLinaX_res,QC_total_allele_THR=10,Annotation=multiome_Annotation) head(cell_type_summary) #> # A tibble: 6 × 20 #>   Sample_ID SNP_ID     CHR      POS Major_allele Reference_SNP REF   ALT   Gene  #>   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>  <dbl> <chr>        <chr>         <chr> <chr> <chr> #> 1 Multiome  chrX:1014… nonP… 1.01e7 B            chrX:4762440… C     A     WWC3  #> 2 Multiome  chrX:1019… nonP… 1.02e8 A            chrX:4762440… T     G     ZMAT1 #> 3 Multiome  chrX:1036… nonP… 1.04e8 A            chrX:4762440… T     C     MORF… #> 4 Multiome  chrX:1036… nonP… 1.04e8 A            chrX:4762440… T     C     MORF… #> 5 Multiome  chrX:1100… nonP… 1.10e8 B            chrX:4762440… G     A     TMEM… #> 6 Multiome  chrX:1189… nonP… 1.19e8 A            chrX:4762440… A     G     LONR… #> # ℹ 11 more variables: XCI_status <chr>, Gene_class <fct>, #> #   Used_as_refGene <chr>, Used_as_refSNP <chr>, Reference_Gene <chr>, #> #   Annotation <chr>, Major_allele_count <dbl>, Minor_allele_count <dbl>, #> #   Total_allele <dbl>, Reference_Cell_Count <int>, minor_allele_ratio <dbl> if (require("ggplot2")) { PBMC_summary$Gene_class<-factor(PBMC_summary$Gene_class,levels=c("PAR1","nonPAR_escape","nonPAR_variable","nonPAR_inactive","nonPAR_unknown","PAR2"))  p<-ggplot(PBMC_summary,aes(x=Gene_class,y=minor_allele_ratio,fill=Gene_class))+   geom_boxplot()+ theme_bw()+ theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1, size = 10), axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10),aspect.ratio=2/3,legend.position="none")+ scale_fill_manual(     values=c("PAR1"="#ae2d68","nonPAR_escape"="#ff1700","nonPAR_variable"="#ffa600",     "nonPAR_inactive"="#9db300","nonPAR_unknown"="#666666","PAR2"="#729efd"))+   xlab("")+ylab("ratio of the expression from Xi") p } #> Loading required package: ggplot2

title: scLinaX_vignette
text: XCI induces chromatin-level transcriptional repression Xi, transcriptionally active chromatin state Xi can observed escape XCI. scLinaX-multi computational tool designed quantification escape X chromosome inactivation chromatin accessibility level using single-cell multi-omics (RNA + ATAC) data 10X multiome.

title: scLinaX_vignette
text: demo, load additional test dataset included within scLinaX package. Let’s run scLinaX-multi! Note scLinaX-multi takes output scLinaX input. result dataframe (tibble) containing raw per-cell scLinaX-multi results. used subsequent process. case scLinaX analysis, results summarized using summarize_scLinaX_multi function analysis. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio accessible chromatin derived inactivated X chromosome cells. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio accessible chromatin derived inactivated X chromosome cell annotation. Let’s check result scLinaX-multi analysis. minor_allele_ratio (ratio accessible chromatin Xi) tend high escapee genes compared nonPAR genes expected.
code: data("multiome_ATAC_ASE_data") data("multiome_peak_data") scLinaX_multi_res<-run_scLinaX_multi(PBMC_summary,scLinaX_res,multiome_ATAC_ASE_data,                               multiome_peak_data,SNP_DETECTION_DP=30,SNP_DETECTION_MAF=0.10)  head(scLinaX_multi_res) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>   SNP_ID    Sample_ID    POS REF   ALT   cell_barcode REFcount ALTcount OTHcount #>   <chr>     <chr>      <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>           <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     AAACCGCGTCT…        1        0        0 #> 2 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     AACAGATAGAC…        1        0        0 #> 3 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     ACTTAGTCAGG…        1        0        0 #> 4 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     AGCCAGTGTTC…        1        0        0 #> 5 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     ATGTGAGAGAC…        1        0        0 #> 6 chrX:101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     ATTGTGATCGC…        1        0        0 #> # ℹ 8 more variables: Xa <chr>, Peak_name <chr>, Gene <chr>, XCI_status <chr>, #> #   CHR <chr>, Gene_class <fct>, A_allele_count <dbl>, B_allele_count <dbl> ATAC_PBMC_summary<-summarize_scLinaX_multi(scLinaX_multi_res,QC_total_allele_THR=10,Annotation=NULL) head(ATAC_PBMC_summary) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   SNP_ID  Peak_name Sample_ID    POS REF   ALT   Gene  Gene_class A_allele_count #>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>      <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <fct>               <dbl> #> 1 chrX:1… chrX-101… Multiome  1.01e7 G     A     CLCN4 nonPAR_in…              6 #> 2 chrX:1… chrX-102… Multiome  1.02e8 T     C     BEX5  nonPAR_un…             21 #> 3 chrX:1… chrX-103… Multiome  1.03e8 C     G     BEX4  nonPAR_in…              2 #> 4 chrX:1… chrX-103… Multiome  1.03e8 C     G     BEX3  nonPAR_in…              0 #> 5 chrX:1… chrX-103… Multiome  1.04e8 G     T     TCEA… nonPAR_in…              4 #> 6 chrX:1… chrX-103… Multiome  1.04e8 A     G     MORF… nonPAR_in…            174 #> # ℹ 4 more variables: B_allele_count <dbl>, Total_allele_count <dbl>, #> #   minor_allele_ratio <dbl>, Major_allele <chr>   ATAC_cell_type_summary<-summarize_scLinaX_multi(scLinaX_multi_res,QC_total_allele_THR=10,Annotation=multiome_Annotation) head(ATAC_cell_type_summary) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   SNP_ID   Sample_ID Annotation    POS REF   ALT   Gene  Gene_class Major_allele #>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <fct>      <chr>        #> 1 chrX:10… Multiome  CD14 Mono  1.03e8 C     G     BEX3  nonPAR_in… B            #> 2 chrX:10… Multiome  CD14 Mono  1.04e8 G     T     TCEA… nonPAR_in… B            #> 3 chrX:10… Multiome  CD14 Mono  1.04e8 A     G     MORF… nonPAR_in… A            #> 4 chrX:10… Multiome  CD16 Mono  1.04e8 A     G     MORF… nonPAR_in… A            #> 5 chrX:10… Multiome  CD4 Naive  1.04e8 A     G     MORF… nonPAR_in… A            #> 6 chrX:10… Multiome  CD4 TCM    1.04e8 A     G     MORF… nonPAR_in… A            #> # ℹ 4 more variables: A_allele_count <dbl>, B_allele_count <dbl>, #> #   Total_allele_count <dbl>, minor_allele_ratio <dbl> if (require("ggplot2")) { ATAC_PBMC_summary$Gene_class<-factor(ATAC_PBMC_summary$Gene_class,levels=c("PAR1","nonPAR_escape","nonPAR_variable","nonPAR_inactive","nonPAR_unknown","PAR2"))  p<-ggplot(ATAC_PBMC_summary,aes(x=Gene_class,y=minor_allele_ratio,fill=Gene_class))+   geom_boxplot()+ theme_bw()+ theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1, size = 10), axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10),aspect.ratio=2/3,legend.position="none")+ scale_fill_manual(     values=c("PAR1"="#ae2d68","nonPAR_escape"="#ff1700","nonPAR_variable"="#ffa600",     "nonPAR_inactive"="#9db300","nonPAR_unknown"="#666666","PAR2"="#729efd"))+   xlab("")+ylab("ratio of the accessible chromatin derived from Xi") p }

title: scLinaX_vignette
text: scLinaX, inactivated X chromosome estimated based allelic expression pattern X-linked genes completely subjected XCI. used annotation Tukiainen et al., Nature, 2017, additional manual curation. remove potential escapee genes list, performed additional QC based scASE data. Although supply AIDA_QCREF object generated AIDA dataset, user can also make data gene QC. , demonstrated usage function making data. Note strongly recommend using function large number samples. demonstration, use function multiome dataset, single sample dataset, recommended actual analysis.

title: scLinaX_vignette
code: Multiome_QCREF<-run_RefGeneQC(multiome_ASE_df,XCI_ref,SNP_DETECTION_DP=30,SNP_DETECTION_MAF=0.1,SAMPLE_NUM_THR=1,HE_allele_cell_number_THR=50,QC_total_allele_THR=10)  head(Multiome_QCREF) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   Gene   Mean_AR_target SD_AR_target Mean_Total_allele_target #>   <chr>           <dbl>        <dbl>                    <dbl> #> 1 FTX            0.333            NA                       15 #> 2 RPGR           0.214            NA                       14 #> 3 MTMR1          0.167            NA                       18 #> 4 GAB3           0.105            NA                       19 #> 5 DIAPH2         0.0769           NA                       13 #> 6 RPL10          0.0714           NA                       14 #> # ℹ 9 more variables: SD_Total_allele_target <dbl>, Sample_N_target <int>, #> #   Count_target <int>, Mean_AR_reference <dbl>, SD_AR_reference <dbl>, #> #   Mean_Total_allele_reference <dbl>, SD_Total_allele_reference <dbl>, #> #   Sample_N_reference <int>, Count_reference <int>

what: Grouping cells according to the X chromosome subjected to X chromosome inactivation (XCI) in order to assess escape from XCI
title: Grouping cells according to the X chromosome subjected to X chromosome inactivation (XCI) in order to assess escape from XCI
text: scLinaX software quantification escape X chromosome inactivation (XCI). Input scLinaX single-cell level allele-specific expression profile generated single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data (germline genotype data optional). Overview scLinaX scLinaX also extension multi-modal single-cell omics data, scLinaX-multi. scLinaX-multi can evaluate escape XCI chromatin accessibility level. scLinaX-multi takes allele-specific read count data RNA ATAC data. Overview scLinaX-multi

title: Run Gene Quality Control (QC) function — run_RefGeneQC
code: run_RefGeneQC(   ASE_df,   XCI_ref,   SNP_DETECTION_DP = 30,   SNP_DETECTION_MAF = 0.1,   SAMPLE_NUM_THR = 3,   HE_allele_cell_number_THR = 50,   QC_total_allele_THR = 10 )

title: Run Gene Quality Control (QC) function — run_RefGeneQC
text: ASE_df dataframe (tibble) containing single-cell allele-specific expression (scASE) data samples. dataframe following columns: SNP_ID: SNP identifier POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C cell_barcode: Cell barcode REFcount: Allelic expression reference allele ALTcount: Allelic expression alternative allele OTHcount: Allelic expression allele Sample_ID: Sample ID Gene: Gene annotated SNP XCI_ref dataframe (tibble) containing X chromosome inactivation status. dataframe following two columns: Gene: Gene name XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive SNP_DETECTION_DP Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP scASE data. SNP–Sample pairs total allele count least "SNP_DETECTION_DP" used analysis. Default: 30. SNP_DETECTION_MAF Threshold minor allele count scASE data. SNP–Sample pairs minor allele ratio "SNP_DETECTION_MAF" "1 - SNP_DETECTION_MAF" used analysis. Default: 0.1. SAMPLE_NUM_THR Threshold sample size used calculation ratio expression Xi. Genes evaluated least SAMPLE_NUM_THR samples used calculation ratio expression Xi. Default: 3. HE_allele_cell_number_THR Threshold number cells expressing reference SNPs. Candidate reference SNPs expressed least "HE_allele_cell_number_THR" cells used analysis. Default: 50. QC_total_allele_THR Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP used calculating ratio expression Xi. Note count calculated cells successfully assigned group based inactivated X chromosome. filter applied final step scLinax differs "SNP_DETECTION_DP". Default: 10.

title: Run Gene Quality Control (QC) function — run_RefGeneQC
text: dataframe (tibble) following columns: Gene: Gene name Mean_AR_target, SD_AR_target: Mean standard deviation ratio expression Xi across candidate reference genes SNPs gene used references Mean_AR_reference, SD_AR_reference: Mean standard deviation ratio expression Xi gene SNPs candidate reference genes used references Mean_Total_allele_target, SD_Total_allele_target: Mean standard deviation total allele count across data points calculating ARs defined target. Mean_Total_allele_reference, SD_Total_allele_reference: Mean standard deviation total allele count across data points calculating ARs defined reference. Sample_N_target: Number samples calculating ARs defined target. Sample_N_reference: Number samples calculating ARs defined reference. Count_target: Number data points calculating ARs defined target. Count_reference: Number data points calculating ARs defined reference.

title: Generate pseudobulk profiles for individuals and calculate correlations (for internal use only) — run_clustering
text: per_SNP_sample Output make_per_SNP_sample_df function QCed_df Output make_QCed_df function Sample Sample ID valid_ref_genes Output Gene_QC function HE_allele_cell_number_THR Threshold number cells expressing reference SNPs. Candidate reference SNPs expressed least "HE_allele_cell_number_THR" cells used analysis. Default: 50. QC_total_allele_THR Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP used calculating ratio expression Xi. Note count calculated cells successfully assigned group based inactivated X chromosome. filter applied final step scLinax differs "SNP_DETECTION_DP". Default: 10. REMOVE_ESCAPE Boolean: TRUE (default): Remove ASE profiles SNPs escapee genes calculating correlations pseudobulk ASE profiles. FALSE: Include ASE profiles SNPs escapee genes calculating correlations pseudobulk ASE profiles. PVAL_THR Threshold P-values absolute correlation coefficients correlation analysis pseudobulk profiles generated reference SNPs. RHO_THR Threshold absolute correlation coefficients correlation analysis pseudobulk profiles generated reference SNPs.

title: Run scLinaX analysis for all samples — run_scLinaX
text: ASE_df dataframe (tibble) containing single-cell allele-specific expression (scASE) data samples. dataframe following columns: SNP_ID: SNP identifier POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C cell_barcode: Cell barcode REFcount: Allelic expression reference allele ALTcount: Allelic expression alternative allele OTHcount: Allelic expression allele Sample_ID: Sample ID Gene: Gene annotated SNP XCI_ref dataframe (tibble) containing X chromosome inactivation status. dataframe following two columns: Gene: Gene name XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive QCREF dataframe generated reference gene QC (please see run_RefGeneQC function). QCREF following three columns: Gene Mean_AR_target Mean_AR_reference Inactive_Gene_ratio_THR Threshold ratio inactive genes SNP_DETECTION_DP Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP scASE data. SNP–Sample pairs total allele count least "SNP_DETECTION_DP" used analysis. Default: 30. SNP_DETECTION_MAF Threshold minor allele count scASE data. SNP–Sample pairs minor allele ratio "SNP_DETECTION_MAF" "1 - SNP_DETECTION_MAF" used analysis. Default: 0.1. QC_total_allele_THR Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP used calculating ratio expression Xi. Note count calculated cells successfully assigned group based inactivated X chromosome. filter applied final step scLinax differs "SNP_DETECTION_DP". Default: 10. HE_allele_cell_number_THR Threshold number cells expressing reference SNPs. Candidate reference SNPs expressed least "HE_allele_cell_number_THR" cells used analysis. Default: 50. REMOVE_ESCAPE Boolean: TRUE (default): Remove ASE profiles SNPs escapee genes calculating correlations pseudobulk ASE profiles. FALSE: Include ASE profiles SNPs escapee genes calculating correlations pseudobulk ASE profiles. PVAL_THR Threshold P-values absolute correlation coefficients correlation analysis pseudobulk profiles generated reference SNPs. RHO_THR Threshold absolute correlation coefficients correlation analysis pseudobulk profiles generated reference SNPs.

title: Run scLinaX analysis for all samples — run_scLinaX
text: list objects ($result, $raw_exp_result, $Fail_list) representing results scLinaX. Additional objects representing intermediate results scLinaX also included list ($clustering_result, $Max_Num_Table_result, $df_snp_summary, $phasing_result). users may typically need use intermediate objects directly, provided reference. $result: per-sample raw result scLinaX. data redundancy summarized using summarize_scLinaX function analysis. dataframe ($result) following columns: Sample_ID: Sample ID SNP_ID: SNP identifier CHR: PAR nonPAR POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C Gene: Gene name XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive, unknown Gene_class: XCI status combined CHR information PAR1, nonPAR_escape, nonPAR_variable, nonPAR_inactive, nonPAR_unknown, PAR2 Used_as_refGene: Whether Gene used reference gene Yes, Used_as_refSNP: Whether SNP_ID used reference SNP Yes, Total_A_allele, Total_B_allele: Total allele count allele B Total_allele: Total allele count SNP Expressing_cells: Number cells expressing SNP minor_allele_ratio: Ratio expression allele (, B) lower expression Reference_Gene, Reference_SNP: list genes used reference genes SNPs Num_Reference_Gene, Num_Reference_SNP: Number reference genes SNPs Reference_Cell_Count: Number cells showing mono-allelic expression reference SNPs Num_A_cells, Num_B_cells: Number cells showing mono-allelic expression B alleles reference SNPs Num_Fail_cells: Number cells showing bi-allelic expression reference SNPs (removed analysis) $raw_exp_result: per-sample raw result scLinaX. dataframe ($raw_exp_result) following columns: cell_barcode: Cell barcode Sample_ID: Sample ID SNP_ID: SNP identifier CHR: PAR nonPAR POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C REFcount: Allelic expression reference allele ALTcount: Allelic expression alternative allele OTHcount: Allelic expression allele Gene: Gene name XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive, unknown Gene_class: XCI status combined CHR information PAR1, nonPAR_escape, nonPAR_variable, nonPAR_inactive, nonPAR_unknown, PAR2 Used_as_refGene: Whether Gene used reference gene Yes, Used_as_refSNP: Whether SNP_ID used reference SNP Yes, Xa: Information activated X chromosome Allele_A, Allele_B Reference_Gene, Reference_SNP: list genes used reference genes SNPs $Fail_list: List samples scLinaX analysis failed. $clustering_result: Result grouping reference SNPs. Cluster names format Sample_IDclustercluster_ID. $Max_Num_Table_result: dataframe describing number cells. $df_snp_summary: original dataframe Spearman correlation pseudobulk ASE profiles calculated. $phasing_result: Result Spearman correlation analysis pseudobulk ASE profiles.

title: Run scLinaX-multi using the scATAC data and output from scLinaX (Currently, only single sample mode is implemented). — run_scLinaX_multi
code: run_scLinaX_multi(   scLinaX_summary,   scLinaX_obj,   ATAC_ASE_data,   peak_data,   SNP_DETECTION_DP = 30,   SNP_DETECTION_MAF = 0.1 )

title: Run scLinaX-multi using the scATAC data and output from scLinaX (Currently, only single sample mode is implemented). — run_scLinaX_multi
text: scLinaX_summary Output summarize_scLinaX function run Annotaion=NULL option scLinaX_obj list object generated run_scLinaX function. ATAC_ASE_data dataframe (tibble) containing single-cell chromatin accessibility data. dataframe include following columns: SNP_ID: SNP identifier POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C cell_barcode: Cell barcode REFcount: Allelic read count reference allele ALTcount: Allelic read count alternative allele OTHcount: Allelic read count allele Sample_ID: Sample ID peak_data dataframe (tibble) containing peak information called single-cell chromatin accessibility data. dataframe include following columns: start: Genomic position start peak (1-base) end: Genomic position end peak (1-base) Peak_name: Name peak Gene: Nearest gene peak SNP_DETECTION_DP Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP scATAC data. SNP–Sample pairs total allele count least "SNP_DETECTION_DP" used analysis. Default: 30. SNP_DETECTION_MAF Threshold minor allele count scASE data. SNP–Sample pairs minor allele ratio "SNP_DETECTION_MAF" "1 - SNP_DETECTION_MAF" used analysis. Default: 0.1.

title: Run scLinaX-multi using the scATAC data and output from scLinaX (Currently, only single sample mode is implemented). — run_scLinaX_multi
text: dataframe (tibble) containing raw per-cell scLinaX-multi results. dataframe include following columns: cell_barcode: Cell barcode Sample_ID: Sample ID SNP_ID: SNP identifier CHR: PAR nonPAR POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C REFcount: Allelic read count reference allele ALTcount: Allelic read count alternative allele OTHcount: Allelic read count allele Peak_name: Name peak Gene: Nearest gene peak XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive, unknown Gene_class: XCI status combined CHR information PAR1, nonPAR_escape, nonPAR_variable, nonPAR_inactive, nonPAR_unknown, PAR2 Xa: Information activated X chromosome Allele_A, Allele_B A_allele_count, B_allele_count: Total allele count allele B

text: scLinaX_obj list object generated run_scLinaX function. QC_total_allele_THR Threshold total allele count (depth) SNP used calculating ratio expression Xi. Note count calculated cells successfully assigned group based inactivated X chromosome. filter applied final step scLinax differs "SNP_DETECTION_DP". Default: 10. Annotation dataframe (tibble) annotation cells. dataframe following columns: cell_barcode Annotation

title: Summarize scLinaX results (return per-individual summary) — summarize_scLinaX
text: dataframe (tibble) containing scLinaX results. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio expression inactivated X chromosome cells. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio expression inactivated X chromosome cell annotation. dataframe includes following columns: Sample_ID: Sample ID SNP_ID: SNP identifier CHR: PAR nonPAR POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C Gene: Gene name XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive, unknown Gene_class: XCI status combined CHR information PAR1, nonPAR_escape, nonPAR_variable, nonPAR_inactive, nonPAR_unknown, PAR2 Used_as_refGene: Whether Gene used reference gene Yes, Used_as_refSNP: Whether SNP_ID used reference SNP Yes, Total_A_allele, Total_B_allele: Total allele count allele B Total_allele: Total allele count SNP Expressing_cells: Number cells expressing SNP minor_allele_ratio: Ratio expression allele (, B) lower expression (=Ratio expression Xi) Reference_Gene, Reference_SNP: list genes used reference genes SNPs Num_Reference_Gene, Num_Reference_SNP: Number reference genes SNPs Reference_Cell_Count: Number cells showing mono-allelic expression reference SNPs Num_A_cells, Num_B_cells: Number cells showing mono-allelic expression B alleles reference SNPs Num_Fail_cells: Number cells showing bi-allelic expression reference SNPs (removed analysis) per-cell annotation mode, includes additional columns: Major_allele: allele higher read count , B Annotation: Cell annotation

title: Summarize scLinaX-multi results — summarize_scLinaX_multi
text: dataframe (tibble) containing scLinaX-multi results. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio accessible chromatin derived inactivated X chromosome cells. Annotation supplied, function returns ratio accessible chromatin derived inactivated X chromosome cell annotation. dataframe includes following columns: Sample_ID: Sample ID SNP_ID: SNP identifier CHR: PAR nonPAR POS: Genomic position SNP (GRCh38) REF: Reference allele SNP ,T,G,C ALT: Alternative allele SNP ,T,G,C REFcount: Allelic read count reference allele ALTcount: Allelic read count alternative allele OTHcount: Allelic read count allele Peak_name: Name peak Gene: Nearest gene peak XCI_status: XCI status escape, variable, inactive, unknown Gene_class: XCI status combined CHR information PAR1, nonPAR_escape, nonPAR_variable, nonPAR_inactive, nonPAR_unknown, PAR2 A_allele_count, B_allele_count: Total allele count allele B Total_allele_count: Total allele count minor_allele_ratio: Ratio accessible chromatin derived allele (, B) lower expression (=Ratio accessible chromatin derived Xi) Major_allele: allele higher read count , B per-cell annotation mode, includes additional column: Annotation: Cell annotation
